metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3526 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in Linux Kernel. This vulnerability affects the function macvlan_handle_frame of the file drivers/net/macvlan.c of the component skb. The manipulation leads to memory leak. The attack can be initiated remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211024. It was discovered that a memory leak existed in the macvlan driver in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
